newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Saudi minister in Canberra trade talks in Oct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Saudi minister in Canberra trade talks in Oct.

text.p: Saudi Arabian Commerce Minister Osama Faqeih would co-chair Australia-Saudi Arabian trade talks with Australian Trade Minister Tim Fischer in Canberra on October 17, Fischer's office said on Monday.

The Australia-Saudi Arabia Joint Ministerial Commission (JMC) meeting, including business delegates from Australian industry groups, would give the private sector a chance to discuss trade policy issues and develop commercial contacts, it said.
"The JMC meeting will provide an umbrella for the further development of trade between Australia and Saudi Arabia," it said in a statement.
Faqeih, heading a 56 member delegation, would also meet government officials and business leaders in Western Australia and Victoria before arriving in Canberra.
He would visit Sydney after Canberra.
Australia had a A$474 million trade deficit with Saudi Arabia in 1994/95, mainly due to imports of crude and refined petroleum and oils.
